video.title: The Future of JavaScript
video.description:
This panel discussion on the future of Javascript at the JS Kongress 2017 conference features Brian Terlson, Mathias Bynens, and Benedikt Meurer.

The goal of freeCodeCamp Talks is to share great Creative Commons software talks to a wider audience.

-
Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Loppy2345
topLevelComment.text: TL:DR Javascript sucks, but the internet needs to rely on it. They are more interested in Web Assembly.

topLevelComment.author: Maruf Monir
topLevelComment.text: sir , i want to learn JavaScript.

topLevelComment.author: Derick Burton
topLevelComment.text: Can anyone give me a TL;DR? ..or TL;DW?

replies.author: Chris K
replies.text: It’s 20% faster with strict types, but you can’t break compatibility with all the libraries. Don’t use new functionality in performance critical code, there’s no point optimising until we get data from the real world. Benchmarks don’t mean much. Open source is good etc, we’re on GitHub. Nerd talk. It’s hard to optimise with node.js because you don’t always see the code published. Q&A Different languages on JavaScript are interesting. Compiled JavaScript is interesting but I don’t know if it’s possible.

replies.author: VinceG
replies.text:
No problem mate. But I wanted to make it clear for everyone because of what you said: " These guys are more or less selling it the whole time, but it actually looks great". I think the video is worth watching, even if no real BIG breaking news is said inside :-)!

Wish you a happy coding ;)

replies.author: Alex Googlehead
replies.text: VinceG you're completely right! But i'm not an english speaker so i couldn't explain it better. I just tried explaining it so someone research it and watches the vid.

replies.author: VinceG
replies.text: Summing this up with "it's about typescript" is just the same as saying "I didn't watch the video"... They talk about type systems, how easy/difficult it would be to integrate that to the language; they also talk about tc39; Babel; WebAssembly; Bundling apps; etc.
